snippet: Only about 15 ambulance teams are available to aid Monrovia, a city of nearly 1.5 million people, where hundreds of new Ebola cases are reported each week.
abstract: Only about 15 ambulance teams are available to aid Monrovia, Liberia, city of nearly 1.5 million people, where hundreds of new Ebola cases are reported each week, with many more never accounted for; to confront spread of virus, some community groups have stepped in, motivated by altruism, desperation and, in some cases, political opportunism.
lead_paragraph: Only about 15 ambulance teams are available to aid Monrovia, a city of nearly 1.5 million people, where hundreds of new Ebola cases are reported each week.

headline.seo: Video Feature: Fighting Ebola, Street by Street
headline.main: Ambulance Work in Liberia Is a Busy and Lonely Business
headline.print_headline: On Ambulance in Liberia Ebola Zone, Work Is Desperate and Lonely
